author: Special Correspondent
text:
V. Sobhana Bai, Director, Educational Multimedia Research Centre (EMMRC), Madurai Kamaraj University, on Wednesday asked the teachers to develop e-content to support students for personalised learning.

Inaugurating the national conference on “Higher Education in the Knowledge Age: Techno-Pedagogical Perspectives and Innovation” organised by the Department of Educational Technology of Bharathidasan University and St. Joseph’s College here, she said the teaching and learning process had seen a paradigm shift over the years.

E. Ramganesh, Head, Department of Educational Technology and Director, UGC Human Resource Development Centre, Bharathidasan University, said 134 private universities had been established in the last five years under the State legislations.

The centre had allocated Rs. 1.75 crore for education for the 12{+t}{+h}Plan period.

The Information and Communication Technology (ICT) had brought many opportunities to solve the issues.

Rev. Fr. S. Sebastian, secretary, St. Joseph’s College, Rev. Fr. F. Andrew, Principal, S. Senthilnathan, Assistant Professor, and S. Alfred Cecil Raj, Dean, Internal Quality Assurance Cell of St. Joseph’s College, participated.
title: Develop e-content for personalised support to students, teachers told
